Detailed Description

A TabButton is used by the class TabControl for displaying the header of tab pages. The view of a TabButton can be configured by implementing an instance of the class TabButtonView. Usually it is not required that an application instantiates a TabButton itself, as this is done internally by the TabControl.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

Reimplemented from AbstractButton.

enum TabButton::PositionHint
 

Gives a hint of the position of the tab button. This is required for the implementation of the view object.

Enumerator:
LeftPos  The tab button is the left most button.
MiddlePos  The tab button is in the middle of the left and right most button. A tab button can only have this hint, if at least 3 tab buttons are part of the tab control.
RightPos  The tab button is the right most button.

void TabButton::SetActive (  BOOLEAN  active  ) 
 

Activates the tab button, which means that the tab page related to this tab button will be shown.

void TabButton::SetPositionHint (  PositionHint  pos_hint  ) 
 

Sets a hint about the position of the tab which is required for the implementation of the tab button view.

const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.
